comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

I'm not sure why anybody would want to do the following, discovered it while trying to find all error dialogs the detail formatter dialog could produce.

While stopped at a breakpoint in a java program, edit a detail formatter using the context menu in the variables view.
Change the code snippet to "throw new Exception();".
When I pressed ok, the stack frame resumed, the variables view emptied, and the program sat there waiting.
When I suspended the main thread, it returned to where the breakpoint was.

I tried it again using 'throw new NullPointerException();' and didn't see the same behaviour, but when I terminated the target, I got the following exception in the log...

eclipse.buildId=I20070323-1616
java.version=1.5.0_09
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -startup C:\Eclipse\eclipse-SDK-I20070323-1616-win32\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070319.jar
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -startup C:\Eclipse\eclipse-SDK-I20070323-1616-win32\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070319.jar

Error
Tue Mar 27 12:19:21 CDT 2007
Exception processing async thread queue

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIVoidValue.<init>(JDIVoidValue.java:26)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget.voidValue(JDIDebugTarget.java:1762)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.Interpreter.getResult(Interpreter.java:102)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.ASTEvaluationEngine$EvalRunnable.run(ASTEvaluationEngine.java:523)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$ThreadJob.run(JDIThread.java:2594)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I don't know what the proper behaviour should be.  It seems pretty strange to want to throw an exception in a detail formatter.  Marking as minor.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 182158 ***
